mechanoreception.notes: As sponges, Metaniidae likely possess basic mechanoreception capabilities to respond to water flow and physical stimuli. This is inferred from general sponge biology.

chemoreception.notes: Likely rely on chemoreception to detect food particles and other chemical cues in their freshwater environment. This is a common trait in sponges for feeding and other physiological processes.

photoreception.notes: The presence and nature of photoreception in Metaniidae is currently unknown based on the provided text. Sponges, in general, do not possess sophisticated light sensory systems.
